instructions: Before writing any code, check for common mistakes:
- Never use relative imports with dot notation (e.g. `from .module import x`). Always use absolute imports like `from my_package.module import x`.
- Use proper Python package paths compatible with my workspace structure.
- Always verify file references match the actual directory layout.
- Use explicit return statements, no implicit None returns.
- Avoid writing unnecessary try/except blocks around simple code.
- Use consistent 4-space indentation and PEP8 style.
- When editing existing code, preserve docstrings and comments.
- Try to keep the README.md file up to date with any changes made to the code.
